description.narrative: Transforming the Market for Efficient Lighting - reduction of greenhouse gas emissions by transforming market towards more energy efficient lighting technologies
Dissemination and Replication of the Project Results
New EE lighting projects cofunded using carbon finance procedures

comment.narrative: Currently no EE lighting projects in Ukraine have been started using JI carbon finance
not given
Currently there are no new EE lighting projects cofunded using carbon finance procedures

description.narrative: Information publications training workshops for municipality staff

comment.narrative: Quite a number of various publications on EE Lighting is available however quite a few describe successful projects implemented in Ukraine

At least 2 information publications for municipalities
At least 10 training workshops provided for different municipalities not previously covered by this project

The International conference DEVELOPMENT OF ENERGYEFFICIENT LIGHTING MARKET IN UKRAINE CURRENT STATUS AND PROSPECTS was held in November 2014 It was dedicated to the Project progress and plans on 2015 year also it was the framework to endorse by public the developed RoadMap and laws
Guidebook on EE lighting has been elaborated and it is currently planned to be integrated into Ukrainian Universities Curricula for technical specialties ecological bias and environmental specialties technical and economic bias
The book on implementation of energy efficient streetligthing for municipalities is produced and is currently planned to be disseminated among all municipalities of Ukraine

description.narrative: Expansionreplication of the EE lighting projects in new municipalities

comment.narrative: not given
Expansionreplication of the EE lighting projects in 20 new municipalities

In total 5 municipalities follow the project experience by the end of this reporting period These include two new municipalities of Slavutich and Dniprodzerzhinsk that have started the process of redevelopment and reorganization of their EE street lighting using the projects expertise

description.narrative: Implement efficient lighting demonstrations in municipal educational sector
Estimated amounts of energy saved and corresponding GHG reductions attained due to the Project activities

comment.narrative:
Baseline for each project is calculated based on the initial consumption and equipment initially used The baseline calculations has been done based on consultations with relevant expertsenergy audit companies
Approximately 2604 TWhyr of electricity consumed predominantly using incandesced bulbs
Lighting systems of 50 project sitesfacilities in 7 municipalities to be duly upgraded with EE lighting
There are 11 Pilots in 8 municipalities as of 30 June 2015

description.narrative: Number of successfully completed projects for upgradingcomplete overhaul of lighting systems

comment.narrative: Baselines for energysavings will need to be established during the project for participating institutions
Siteslocationsfacilities in at least 7 municipalities have been duly upgraded with EE lighting systems

There are 11 Pilots implemented by 30 June The Project has held a tender for purchase of uptodate street office and household EE light sources in order to distribute thereof among 9 municipalities on competitive basis in the second half of 2015 The total numbers of purchased bulbs are 5000 of HSVLs 4000 LEDs 3000 CFLs

description.narrative: Improve EE Lighting product penetration in the Residential Sector
1 Residential EE lighting products sales uplift due to the Project activities

comment.narrative: Ukrainian market current statistics stating EE light products sales uplift
EE lighting productsequipment annualized market growth rate is doubled equaling to 20 currently 1015

The annualized EEL market growth rate in the reporting period was 19 according to the assessment done by the expert on GHG emissions reduction
ALLUKRAINIAN PUBLIC AWARENESS PROMOTIONAL CAMPAIGN ON ENERGY EFFICIENT LIGHTING PHASE 2 has been launched in summer 2015 and to be completed in winter 20152016 The Phase 2 of the Campaign is focused on rural and recreational areas which were not covered by Phase 1 The campaign includes presentation of specially developed features scientific movie and cartoon on Ukrainian TV 25 regional and 7 national channels According to estimations this will allow to increase the demand on EEL by 23

description.narrative: 2 Energy savings gained using CFLs disseminated by the Project

To disseminate at least 40 million additional EE lighting products within the residential sector

08 TWhyr owning to indirect activities for the reporting period or cumulative 18 TWh

description.narrative: Improve the National policy framework for promoting EE lighting
Adoption of new legislation promoting EE lighting technologies

comment.narrative: Current legislation
National RoadMap for Ukrainian market transition over to EE lighting has been accepted by the Government

National Roadmap for EE lighting market transformation was created and endorsed by public representatives at International conference Development Of EnergyEfficient Lighting Market In Ukraine Current status and prospects
Draft law providing for the phaseout of incandescent bulbs has been duly prepared Draft law and technical regulation for disposal of CFLs have been developed
New sanitary and hygienic health and safety requirements covering LED have been duly prepared
A Study of legal relations covering consumer protection to ensure the quality of electricity supplied was conducted The Project has engaged two experts to support the implementation of the RoadMap for energy inefficient bulbs phaseout from the Ukrainian market

description.narrative: Improved QualityAssurance Quality Control systems for imported and produced lighting products in Ukraine
A new municipal system for CFL collection recycling andor disposal has been launched

comment.narrative: Current unavailability of adequate and orderly operating system
Locally adapted sustainable system developed based on the international best practice

The traditional conference on the strategy of disposal of mercury containing light sources in Ukraine was held in October 2014 There was more than 200 participants The main objective of the conference was to conduct public and professional hearings on new legislation on waste handling In particular the TMEL Project presented the developed strategy technical regulation and law on utilization of household CFLs that were endorsed in resolution of the Conference
The pilot project for disposal of CFLs was completed and results thereof have been applied to develop the CFL disposal system used in several nationwide supermarket chains The Project targeted 7 cities throughout Ukraine and was focused on exchange of used CFLs for the discount to buy a new one During one month approximately 44 000 of CFLs were disposed by mobile disposal factory Also the dedicated materials covering disposal of CFLs have been developed and disseminated among the retail store networks

description.narrative:
Decline of supplyavailability of substandard EE lighting products in Ukraine
Improvement of product qualityprice ratios ie product life lumens spectral output etc

comment.narrative: Тo be established by project through sampling product supply statistics WHY DONT WE HAVE THIS
Increased standards for EE lighting products available on the market decreased quantities of poor quality grey lighting products available on the market NEEDS NUMBERS

Largescale Assessment of quality of household EE light sources as well as largescale Assessment of quality of street light sources were conducted These studies will help to see the real picture of Ukrainian lighting market including the share of grey ligthing sources The results of the studies will be used to strengthen customs policy of Ukraine
Largescale Assessment of quality of office light sources has been commenced in March 2015 Results are expected by September 2015 The summarized results of all abovementioned assessments will be presented at the conference on 2224 October 2015

description.narrative: To transform the Ukrainian market towards efficient lighting technologies and the phaseout of inefficient lighting
Estimated amount of energy saved and corresponding GHG reductions attained due to the Project activities

comment.narrative: Approximately 2604 TWhyr of electricity consumed predominantly by incandesced bulbs IB
To reduce power consumption to 2108 TWhyr by phasingout of IB and replacing thereof with EE Technologies

The Project moves towards the completing of overall objective as the annual power consumption of IB is 2060 TWhyr based on the independent study of RBC group However this reduction caused not only by the Project activties and market factors but also by the hostilities at the Eastern Ukraine as well as by special status of Cremea
